data.message: when are you going to use biodegradable materials?  Set the standard.  At least this bottle (now useless litter) has been upcycled....although not sure what it was used for.  I put it in the bin, including contents.

replies.message: Hi James, we’ve already been using renewable packaging innovations for many years, like the PlantBottle. The first fully recyclable plastic bottle made partly with a special plastic from plant material. To keep up to date with all of our future sustainability announcements  www.coca-cola.co.uk/sustainability-section

Coca-Cola By recyclable does that mean recycled, or just just that it can be?  because no-one seems to bother.  if packaging  rotted away that would be great.  I suppose profit margins are profit margins......Surely you could set the standard (and make a few quid in the process...imagine the very first company to use degradable products.  Wow.😃
